solution.text:
Let the number be x.
Now, according to the data provided in the question,
\((\frac 13 \times x) - _{j}_ = _{{j+33}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac x3 = _{{j+33}}_ + _{j}_\) [Taking all constants to one side]
\(\Rightarrow \frac x3 = _{{j+33+j}}_\)
Cross-multiplying:
\(x = 3 \times _{{j+33+j}}_ = _{{3*(j+33+j)}}_\)
Therefore, the number is _{{3*(j+33) + (3*j)}}_

content.text: Find a number, such that one-third of the number is _{j}_ more than _{{j+33}}_
